item.rp:teaser: Popular with designers, architects, engineers and people who like the TV show How Stuff Works.
item.title: 99% Invisible-01- 99% Noise
item.description: This episode of 99% Invisible is all about acoustic design, the city soundscape, and how to make listening in shared spaces pleasant (or at the very least, possible). It features an interview with Dennis Paoletti from Shen Milsom & Wilke.

item.title: 3 Miles Away, 20 Minutes Late
item.dc:creator: aceadmin
item.description: Ray and Stromer discuss the best ‘bang for your buck’ home improvements. They also chat about opening up your ceiling, guys who are too relaxed on the job site, and how to deal with termite damage. Show Summary Ray and Stromer open the show talking about Eric’s family routine, and complaining about guys who are […]
item.content:encoded:
Ray and Stromer discuss the best ‘bang for your buck’ home improvements. They also chat about opening up your ceiling, guys who are too relaxed on the job site, and how to deal with termite damage.

    Show Summary

    Ray and Stromer open the show talking about Eric’s family routine, and complaining about guys who are too relaxed on the job site. The guys then respond to a video question about termite damage, and a second video about renovating an outdoor fountain. This week’s email question deals with a moisture issue in someone’s foundation. Later, the guys talk to callers about the best ‘bang for your buck’ home improvements, and how to open up the ceiling in your living room. As the show wraps up, the guys recall some of their favorite football coaches growing up.

    Make sure to follow Ray and Eric on Twitter @RayOldhafer @EricStromer.

    Tell a friend about the show, and please support our sponsors.

    This Week’s Video Questions

    Adam & Ray’s Tool Kit Gift Guide

    Click our Tool Gift Guide, tell a friend about the show, and please support our sponsors.

    Tell a friend about the show, and please support our sponsors.

    Want To Submit A Video Question??

    Grab one with your phone, or just flip your snapshot camera into video mode.

    Email us a YouTube link, or send us a small vid (no more than 10 MB). aceonthehouse@adamcarolla.com

    Want To Call In??

    Follow us @AceOnTheHouse and get the jump on everyone else
    You can also follow Ray @RayOldhafer

    Show Credits

    Producers: Matt Fondiler & Gary Smith
    Audio/Post-Production/Show Summary: Matt Fondiler
    Phones/Researcher/Web Engineer: Gary Smith

    Ace on the House Theme Song: Jason Boots (hear more music at http://JasonBoots.com)

item.rp:teaser: If you enjoy Dateline NBC, 48 Hours, 20/20, 60 Minutes
item.title: S01 Episode 01: The Alibi
item.description: It's Baltimore, 1999. Hae Min Lee, a popular high-school senior, disappears after school one day. Six weeks later detectives arrest her classmate and ex-boyfriend, Adnan Syed, for her murder. He says he's innocent - though he can't exactly remember what he was doing on that January afternoon. But someone can. A classmate at Woodlawn High School says she knows where Adnan was. The trouble is, she’s nowhere to be found.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: It's Baltimore, 1999. Hae Min Lee, a popular high-school senior, disappears after school one day. Six weeks later detectives arrest her classmate and ex-boyfriend, Adnan Syed, for her murder. He says he's innocent - though he can't exactly remember...
item.itunes:summary: It's Baltimore, 1999. Hae Min Lee, a popular high-school senior, disappears after school one day. Six weeks later detectives arrest her classmate and ex-boyfriend, Adnan Syed, for her murder. He says he's innocent - though he can't exactly remember what he was doing on that January afternoon. But someone can. A classmate at Woodlawn High School says she knows where Adnan was. The trouble is, she’s nowhere to be found.

item.rp:teaser: If you enjoy Sex and the City, Broad City, Girls
item.title: Introducing ‘Modern Love: The Podcast’
item.dc:creator: WBUR
item.description: Explore the trials and tribulations of love in these deeply personal essays. A collaboration of The New York Times and WBUR in Boston, Modern Love: The Podcast features the popular New York Times column, with readings by notable personalities and updates from the essayists themselves. Join host Meghna Chakrabarti (WBUR) and Modern Love editor Daniel Jones (NYT) -- and fall in love at first listen.

item.rp:teaser: Popular with people who love funny, sad and inspirational stories that move you.
item.title: Monica Cheru-Mpambawashe & Ruth Adong & Lebo Moletsane: Stories from The Moth Community Program
item.dc:creator: Mooj Zadie
item.description:
Three stories developed and crafted in The Moth Community Program:
A daughter is confronted by her parent's empty fridge, a girl struggles with her family's neighborly etiquette, and a teacher speaks up in defense of one of her female students.

item.title: No. 1A or No. 2? : 3/4/16
item.itunes:author: ESPN
item.description: Tony Kornheiser is joined by Pablo Torre. They discuss if Steve Kerr will favor rest over record, where the Spurs should be being ranked against the Warriors, Carmelo Anthony's relationship with the Knicks and more.

item.title: Falling in Love... With Heroin
item.description:
Susanne* met Mike* when she was 16. He was 18, and her supervisor at the call center where they worked. They flirted and started dating. "Average teenager stuff," Susanne recalls. Soon after they got together, Mike offered Susanne heroin. She says she had never even smoked pot before.

"I don’t want to be mean, but I felt pressured into doing it. So, I did," she adds. "And then I fell in love."

Heroin took over Susanne and Mike's lives for the next five years. Mike admits that their story, though increasingly common, looks bad from the outside. "I should’ve said, 'Hey, this is probably not the best way to move forward with my life,'" he reflects, "But there’s some things that’re more important, I guess. Like heroin addiction."

Through overdoses, incarcerations and three pregnancies, Susanne and Mike kept their relationship intact, even as relationships with family deteriorated. Methadone treatment finally helped them kick their habit. Today, they say it's been almost 10 years since they last used heroin. They moved to a nice neighborhood hundreds of miles away from where their lives began to spiral. Mike found a well-paying job, but felonies on both their records have limited their career options.

And true stability continues to be elusive. During our fact-checking process, we uncovered a pending criminal charge that Susanne and Mike hadn't shared with us at first. And it casts their interview in a different light. When we checked in with them again, it became apparent that the outcome of this story—and their relationship—is far from clear. 

*Names changed
item.itunes:summary: Susanne and Mike met and fell in love with each other...and heroin. They stuck together through addiction and recovery, but things haven't fallen into place the way they had hoped.
item.author: WNYC (WNYC Studios)

item.description: This is a series about what happens when someone …

item.itunes:subtitle: This is a series about what happens when someone …
item.itunes:summary: This is a series about what happens when someone who knows nothing about business starts one. It's called StartUp.  In episode one, Alex Blumberg botches his pitch to Silicon Valley billionaire Chris Sacca.
item.author: hearstartup@gmail.com (Gimlet)
